intro: Campanula incanescens var. holosericea, commonly known as the silky bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems covered in dense, white to grayish-white hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to thrive in dry, rocky environments. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate poor soil conditions.
